pdftron.PDF

Interface PDFViewCtrl.Tool

  • Enclosing class:
    PDFViewCtrl

    public static interface PDFViewCtrl.Tool
    Tool interface. A tool provides the support for the interaction between a user and PDFViewCtrl. For more details, please refer to PDFViewCtrl.ToolManager.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getMode()
      Returns the mode/identifier of this tool.
      int getNextToolMode()
      Returns the mode of the next tool.

      Called by PDFViewCtrl in the next message loop of the main thread.

    • Method Detail

      • getMode

        int getMode()
        Returns the mode/identifier of this tool.

      • getNextToolMode

        int getNextToolMode()
        Returns the mode of the next tool. Via this method, a tool can indicate the next tool to switch to.

      • onClose

        void onClose()
        Called by PDFViewCtrl to indicate the tool is being closed, e.g., when the current document is being closed. Tool should clean up at this moment, e.g., closing its menu.

      • onCustom

        void onCustom(java.lang.Object o)
        Called by PDFViewCtrl in the next message loop of the main thread. This callback can be registered through PDFViewCtrl.postToolOnCustomEvent(Object) method. Note that this function is called only once per posting.
        Parameters:
        o - The Object passed in when calling PDFViewCtrl.postToolOnCustomEvent(Object).

      • onDoubleTap

        boolean onDoubleTap(MotionEvent e)
        Called at the beginning when PDFViewCtrl.onDoubleTap() is triggered.
        Returns:
        true if the event is swallowed by the tool. This way, PDFViewCtrl will not perform its usual task associated with this event. In general, false should be returned.
        Note:
        By default, PDFViewCtrl changes the zoom when double tapping. But since Tool.onDoubleTap() is called before the zoom is changed, calling PDFViewCtrl.getZoom() in this callback would return the old zoom factor.

      • onDoubleTapEnd

        void onDoubleTapEnd(MotionEvent e)
        Called at the end when PDFViewCtrl.onDoubleTap() is triggered.
        Note:
        By default, PDFViewCtrl changes the zoom when double tapping. Since Tool.onDoubleTapEnd() is called after the zoom is changed, calling PDFViewCtrl.getZoom() in this callback would return the new zoom factor.

      • onDown

        boolean onDown(MotionEvent e)
        Called when PDFViewCtrl.onDown() is triggered.
        Returns:
        true if the event is swallowed by the tool. This way, PDFViewCtrl will not perform its usual task associated with this event. In general, false should be returned.

      • onDocumentDownloadEvent

        void onDocumentDownloadEvent(int type,
                           int page_num,
                           int page_downloaded,
                           int page_count,
                           java.lang.String message)
        Called when an update from document downloading is available, which can be started by PDFViewCtrl.openURL(String, String, String).
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the update. Possible values are:
        • PDFViewCtrl.DOWNLOAD_START
        • PDFViewCtrl.DOWNLOAD_PAGE
        • PDFViewCtrl.DOWNLOAD_FINISH
        • PDFViewCtrl.DOWNLOAD_FAIL
        page_num - the number of the page that is just downloaded. Meaningful if type is PDFViewCtrl.DOWNLOAD_PAGE.
        page_downloaded - the total number of pages that have been downloaded
        page_count - the page count of the associated document
        message - error message in case the download has failed

      • onDraw

        void onDraw(Canvas canvas,
          android.graphics.Matrix tfm)
        Called by PDFViewCtrl to draw tool's content, if there is any. Note that this is called after all the document content is drawn; therefore the content drawn in this function will be on top of the document content.
        Parameters:
        canvas - The android.graphics.Canvas object to draw on PDFViewCtrl.
        tfm - The extra transformation matrix applied to 'canvas'. This matrix is normally an identity matrix unless when the built-in page sliding is in process. The inverse of this matrix can be temporarily applied to 'canvas' in order to make the content drawn in this function appear stationary during sliding.

      • onFlingStop

        boolean onFlingStop()
        Called when a fling motion stops by itself (not by a touching event).
        Returns:
        true if the event is swallowed by the tool. This way, PDFViewCtrl will not perform its usual task associated with this event. In general, false should be returned.

      • onLayout

        void onLayout(boolean changed,
            int l,
            int t,
            int r,
            int b)
        Called when PDFViewCtrl's onLayout(), e.g., android.view.View.onLayout(), is triggered, or PDFViewCtrl's page presentation mode or page view mode is changed by PDFViewCtrl.setPagePresentationMode(int) or PDFViewCtrl.setPageViewMode(int).
        Parameters:
        changed - This is a new size or position for this view.
        l - Left position, relative to parent.
        t - Top position, relative to parent.
        r - Right position, relative to parent.
        b - Bottom position, relative to parent.

      • onLongPress

        boolean onLongPress(MotionEvent e)
        Called when PDFViewCtrl.onLongPress() is triggered.
        Returns:
        true if the event is swallowed by the tool. This way, PDFViewCtrl will not perform its usual task associated with this event. In general, false should be returned.

      • onMove

        boolean onMove(MotionEvent e1,
             MotionEvent e2,
             float x_dist,
             float y_dist)
        Called when PDFViewCtrl.onScroll() is triggered.
        Returns:
        true if the event is swallowed by the tool. This way, PDFViewCtrl will not perform its usual task associated with this event. In general, true should be returned so that while the tool is moving, the content will not be scrolled.

      • onPageTurning

        void onPageTurning(int old_page,
                 int cur_page)
        Called when turning pages in non-continuous page presentation mode.

      • onScale

        boolean onScale(float x,
              float y)
        Called when PDFViewCtrl.onScale() is triggered.
        Returns:
        true if the event is swallowed by the tool. This way, PDFViewCtrl will not perform its usual task associated with this event. In general, false should be returned.

      • onScaleBegin

        boolean onScaleBegin(float x,
                   float y)
        Called when PDFViewCtrl.onScaleBegin() is triggered.
        Returns:
        true if the event is swallowed by the tool. This way, PDFViewCtrl will not perform its usual task associated with this event. In general, false should be returned.

      • onScaleEnd

        boolean onScaleEnd(float x,
                 float y)
        Called when PDFViewCtrl.onScaleEnd() is triggered.
        Returns:
        true if the event is swallowed by the tool. This way, PDFViewCtrl will not perform its usual task associated with this event. In general, false should be returned.

      • onSetDoc

        void onSetDoc()
        Called by PDFViewCtrl after {link PDFViewCtrl.setDoc(PDFDoc) is called and the document is set within PDFViewCtrl.

      • onShowPress

        boolean onShowPress(MotionEvent e)
        Called when onShowPress() is triggered.
        Returns:
        true if the event is swallowed by the tool. This way, PDFViewCtrl will not perform its usual task associated with this event. In general, false should be returned.

      • onSingleTapConfirmed

        boolean onSingleTapConfirmed(MotionEvent e)
        Called when PDFViewCtrl.onSingleTapConfirmed() is triggered.
        Returns:
        true if the event is swallowed by the tool. This way, PDFViewCtrl will not perform its usual task associated with this event. In general, false should be returned.

      • onPostSingleTapConfirmed

        void onPostSingleTapConfirmed()
        Called about 200ms after PDFViewCtrl.onSingleTapConfirmed() is called.
        Note:
        If a new event is triggered by a user after onSingleTapConfirmed() is called but before onPostSingleTapConfirmed() is called, PDFViewCtrl ensures onPostSingleTapConfirmed() is called immediately before the new event. In other words, the 200ms delay is ignored.

      • onSingleTapUp

        boolean onSingleTapUp(MotionEvent e)
        Called when onSingleTapUp() is triggered.
        Returns:
        true if the event is swallowed by the tool. This way, PDFViewCtrl will not perform its usual task associated with this event. In general, false should be returned.

      • onUp

        boolean onUp(MotionEvent e,
           int prior_event_type)
        Called when PDFViewCtrl.onUp() is triggered.
        Parameters:
        e - the up motion event
        prior_event_type - indicates the prior event type. Possible values are:
        • PDFViewCtrl.PRIOR_EVENT_SCROLLING
        • PDFViewCtrl.PRIOR_EVENT_PINCH
        • PDFViewCtrl.PRIOR_EVENT_FLING
        • PDFViewCtrl.PRIOR_EVENT_DBLTAP
        • PDFViewCtrl.PRIOR_EVENT_OTHER
        Returns:
        true if the event is swallowed by the tool. This way, PDFViewCtrl will not perform its usual task associated with this event. In general, false should be returned.
